official-title.#text: To require the Secretary of the Interior to assemble a team of technical, policy, and financial experts to address the energy needs of the insular areas of the United States and the Freely Associated States through the development of energy action plans aimed at promoting access to affordable, reliable energy, including increasing use of indigenous clean-energy resources, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives September 15, 2014.

header.#text: Insular areas and Freely Associated States energy development

text.#text: In this section:

term.#tail: means a comprehensive energy plan prepared and updated under

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: To authorize appropriations for certain insular areas of the United States, and for other purposes/s:604/ss:c

quote.#text: An Act to authorize appropriations for certain insular areas of the United States, and for other purposes

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: To authorize appropriations for certain insular areas of the United States, and for other purposes/s:604/ss:e
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: (e) of section 604 of the Act entitled

term.#tail: means the plan required by subsection (d).

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means the Federated States of Micronesia, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, and the Republic of Palau.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, Guam, and the Virgin Islands.

text.#text: The term
The term

term.#tail: means the team established by the

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish a team of technical, policy, and financial experts—

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the
to develop energy action plans addressing the immediate, near-term, and long-term energy and environmental needs of each of the insular areas and Freely Associated States; and
to assist each of the insular areas and Freely Associated States in implementing an energy action plan.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall consider including regional utility organizations.

text.#text: In establishing the team, the
In accordance with subsection (b), the energy action plans shall include—
recommendations, based on the comprehensive energy plan where applicable, to—
promote access to affordable, reliable energy;
develop indigenous, nonfossil fuel energy resources; and
improve performance of energy infrastructure and overall energy efficiency;
a schedule for implementation of such recommendations and identification and prioritization of specific projects;
a financial and engineering plan for implementing and sustaining projects; and
benchmarks for measuring progress toward implementation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: establishes the team and annually thereafter, the team shall submit to the
a report detailing progress made in fulfilling its charge and in implementing the energy action plans.

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date on which the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: receives a report submitted by the team under subsection (e), the
shall submit to the appropriate committees of
a summary of the report of the team.

text.#text: Not later than 30 days after the date on which the
No additional funds are authorized to be appropriated for the purpose of carrying out this section, and this section shall be carried out using amounts otherwise available for such purpose.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 83 EH: To require the Secretary of the Interior to assemble a team of technical, policy, and financial experts to address the energy needs of the insular areas of the United States and the Freely Associated States through the development of energy action plans aimed at promoting access to affordable, reliable energy, including increasing use of indigenous clean-energy resources, and for other purposes.
